intro: Phlyctidocarpa, commonly known as the blister cherry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the eastern United States and is characterized by its small, red berries that contain a single seed. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has alternate, simple leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are pink to white and appear in clusters, adding to its ornamental value. The fruit is known for its ability to cause a blistering reaction on the skin upon contact, hence its common name.
